intro: Bollea pulvinaris, commonly known as the pulvinar bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often with a purple or violet throat. Bollea pulvinaris typically grows as a perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its unique pulvinated (swollen) base and delicate foliage make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
